00101 inline int default_width_sentinel_()
00102 {
00103     return stlsoft::limit_traits<int>::minimum();
00104 }
00105 
00106 inline int default_precision_sentinel_()
00107 {
00108     return -1;
00109 }
00110 
00111 inline ff_char_t* make_x_upper_(ff_char_t* from, ff_char_t* to)
00112 {
00113     for(; to != from; ++from)
00114     {
00115         if('x' == *from)
00116         {
00117             *from = 'X';
00118             break;
00119         }
00120     }
00121 
00122     return from;
00123 }
00124 
00125 template <typename I>
00126 inline ff_to_i_r_t_ integer_helper_2(
00127     I const&            value
00128 ,   ff_char_t const*    fmt
00129 )
00130 {
00131     STLSOFT_STATIC_ASSERT(stlsoft::is_integral_type<I>::value);
00132 
00133     FASTFORMAT_CONTRACT_ENFORCE_PRECONDITION_PARAMS_INTERNAL(NULL != fmt, "fmt may not be null");
00134 
00135     typedef ff_to_i_r_t_   result_t;
00136 
00137     enum { maxRepeats = 3 };
00138 
00139 #ifdef FASTFORMAT_INSERTER_INTEGER_NO_USE_SHIM_STRING_
00140 
00141     result_t    result(20u, '~');
00142 
00143     { for(int i = 0;; )
00144     {
00145         int n = fastformat_util_snprintf(&result[0], result.size(), fmt, value);
00146 
00147         if(n > int(result.size()))
00148         {
00149             // An implementation that does it correctly, so just resize
00150             // to the desired size and go again
00151 
00152             // This'll only return false when exception-handling is
00153             // suppressed, but the code is correct without preprocessor
00154             // logic in either case, so leave as is
00155             result.resize(n);
00156         }
00157         else if(n < 0)
00158         {
00159             if(maxRepeats == ++i)
00160             {
00161                 result.clear();
00162                 break;
00163             }
00164             else
00165             {
00166                 // This'll only return false when exception-handling is
00167                 // suppressed, but the code is correct without preprocessor
00168                 // logic in either case, so leave as is
00169                 result.resize(1u + result.size() * 3);
00170             }
00171         }
00172         else
00173         {
00174             // It's worked!
00175             //
00176             // We must nul-terminate, and resize, so that the shim string's
00177             // length is evaluated correctly
00178             result.resize(size_t(n));
00179 
00180             break;
00181         }
00182     }}
00183 
00184     return result;
00185 
00186 #else /* ? FASTFORMAT_INSERTER_INTEGER_NO_USE_SHIM_STRING_ */
00187 
00188 
00189 # if _STLSOFT_VER < 0x010a0000 && \
00190      defined(_STLSOFT_1_10_VER) && \
00191      _STLSOFT_1_10_VER < 0x010a0109
00192 
00193     /* Using STLSoft 1.10.1 alpha 1 - alpha 8 */
00194 
00195 #  error This class cannot work with STLSoft 1.10 versions between 1.10.1 alpha 1 and 1.10.1 alpha 9. Please download the latest version of STLSoft 1.10 alpha
00196 
00197 # elif _STLSOFT_VER >= 0x010a0000 || \
00198        defined(_STLSOFT_1_10_VER)
00199 
00200     /* Using STLSoft 1.10+ version of basic_shim_string */
00201 
00202     // We use the public interface of the shim string.
00203 
00204     result_t result(64);
00205 
00206 #  ifndef STLSOFT_CF_THROW_BAD_ALLOC
00207     if(!result.empty())
00208 #  endif /* !STLSOFT_CF_THROW_BAD_ALLOC */
00209     {
00210         // Unlike integral types, the string representation of floating
00211         // point values do not have a known maximum length, so we must be
00212         // flexible.
00213         //
00214         // However, some implementations of snprintf() return -1 instead of
00215         // the length that would be required, so we cannot assume -1
00216         // indicates error. To handle this, we double the size of the buffer
00217         // up to four times, at which point we admit defeat.
00218 
00219         { for(int i = 0;; )
00220         {
00221             int n = fastformat_util_snprintf(result.data(), result.size() - 1, fmt, value);
00222 
00223             if(n > int(result.size()))
00224             {
00225                 // An implementation that does it correctly, so just resize
00226                 // to the desired size and go again
00227 
00228                 // This'll only return false when exception-handling is
00229                 // suppressed, but the code is correct without preprocessor
00230                 // logic in either case, so leave as is
00231                 if(!result.resize(n))
00232                 {
00233                     result.truncate(0);
00234                     break;
00235                 }
00236             }
00237             else if(n < 0)
00238             {
00239                 if(maxRepeats == ++i)
00240                 {
00241                     result.truncate(0);
00242                     break;
00243                 }
00244                 else
00245                 {
00246                     // This'll only return false when exception-handling is
00247                     // suppressed, but the code is correct without preprocessor
00248                     // logic in either case, so leave as is
00249                     if(!result.resize(1u + result.size() * 3))
00250                     {
00251                         result.truncate(0);
00252                         break;
00253                     }
00254                 }
00255             }
00256             else
00257             {
00258                 // It's worked!
00259                 //
00260                 // We must nul-terminate, and resize, so that the shim string's
00261                 // length is evaluated correctly
00262                 result.truncate(size_t(n));
00263 
00264                 break;
00265             }
00266         }}
00267     }
00268 
00269     return result;
00270 
00271 # else /* ? STLSoft 1.x */
00272 
00273     /* Using STLSoft 1.9+ version of basic_shim_string */
00274 
00275     // We have to use the internal buffer, which means that we are
00276     // relying on the internal workings of shim string, which is ugly.
00277     // With 1.10, we don't need to do this.
00278 
00279     result_t                result(64);
00280     result_t::buffer_type&  buffer = result.get_buffer();
00281 
00282 #  ifndef STLSOFT_CF_THROW_BAD_ALLOC
00283     if(!buffer.empty())
00284 #  endif /* !STLSOFT_CF_THROW_BAD_ALLOC */
00285     {
00286         // Unlike integral types, the string representation of floating
00287         // point values do not have a known maximum length, so we must be
00288         // flexible.
00289         //
00290         // However, some implementations of snprintf() return -1 instead of
00291         // the length that would be required, so we cannot assume -1
00292         // indicates error. To handle this, we double the size of the buffer
00293         // up to four times, at which point we admit defeat.
00294 
00295         { for(int i = 0;; )
00296         {
00297             int n = fastformat_util_snprintf(&buffer[0], buffer.size() - 1, fmt, value);
00298 
00299             if(n > int(buffer.size() - 1))
00300             {
00301                 // An implementation that does it correctly, so just resize
00302                 // to the desired size and go again
00303 
00304                 // This'll only return false when exception-handling is
00305                 // suppressed, but the code is correct without preprocessor
00306                 // logic in either case, so leave as is
00307                 if(!buffer.resize(size_t(n) + 1u))
00308                 {
00309                     buffer.resize(1u);
00310                     break;
00311                 }
00312             }
00313             else if(n < 0)
00314             {
00315                 if(maxRepeats == ++i)
00316                 {
00317                     break;
00318                 }
00319                 else
00320                 {
00321                     // This'll only return false when exception-handling is
00322                     // suppressed, but the code is correct without preprocessor
00323                     // logic in either case, so leave as is
00324                     if(!buffer.resize(1u + buffer.size() * 3))
00325                     {
00326                         buffer.resize(1u);
00327                         break;
00328                     }
00329                 }
00330             }
00331             else
00332             {
00333                 // It's worked!
00334                 //
00335                 // We must nul-terminate, and resize, so that the shim string's
00336                 // length is evaluated correctly
00337                 buffer[size_t(n)] = '\0';
00338 
00339                 buffer.resize(size_t(n) + 1u);
00340 
00341                 break;
00342             }
00343         }}
00344     }
00345 
00346     return result;
00347 # endif /* STLSoft 1.x */
00348 #endif /* FASTFORMAT_INSERTER_INTEGER_NO_USE_SHIM_STRING_ */
00349 }
00350 
00351 inline ff_to_i_r_t_ hex_integer_helper(
00352     stlsoft::uint64_t   value
00353 ,   int                 uppercaseAlpha
00354 )
00355 {
00356     ff_char_t   result[17];
00357     int         n = fastformat_util_snprintf(
00358                         &result[0]
00359                     ,   STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(result)
00360 #ifdef FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00361                     ,    stlsoft::integral_printf_traits<stlsoft::uint64_t>::hex_format_w()
00362 #else /* ? FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00363                     ,    stlsoft::integral_printf_traits<stlsoft::uint64_t>::hex_format_a()
00364 #endif /* FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00365                     ,   value);
00366 
00367     if(uppercaseAlpha)
00368     {
00369         typedef stlsoft::ctype_traits<ff_char_t> ctype_traits_t;
00370 
00371         stlsoft::std_transform(result, result + n, result, ctype_traits_t::to_upper);
00372     }
00373 
00374     return ff_to_i_r_t_(result, size_t(n));
00375 }
00376 
00377 inline ff_to_i_r_t_ hex_integer_helper(
00378     stlsoft::sint64_t   value
00379 ,   int                 uppercaseAlpha
00380 )
00381 {
00382     return hex_integer_helper(static_cast<stlsoft::uint64_t>(value), uppercaseAlpha);
00383 }
00384 
00385 template <typename I>
00386 inline ff_to_i_r_t_ hex_integer_helper(
00387     I const&    value
00388 ,   int         uppercaseAlpha
00389 )
00390 {
00391     ff_char_t   fmt[3] = { '%', uppercaseAlpha ? 'X' : 'x', '\0' };
00392     ff_char_t   result[17];
00393     int         n = fastformat_util_snprintf(&result[0], STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(result), fmt, value);
00394 
00395     return ff_to_i_r_t_(result, size_t(n));
00396 }
00397 
00398 template <typename I>
00399 inline ff_to_i_r_t_ integer_helper_5(
00400     I const&    value
00401 ,   int         minimumWidth
00402 ,   int         precision
00403 ,   int         base
00404 ,   int         uppercaseAlpha
00405 )
00406 {
00407     STLSOFT_STATIC_ASSERT(stlsoft::is_integral_type<I>::value);
00408 
00409     FASTFORMAT_CONTRACT_ENFORCE_PRECONDITION_PARAMS_INTERNAL(10 == base || 16 == base, "base must be 10 (decimal) or 16 (hex)");
00410 
00411     if( default_width_sentinel_() == minimumWidth &&
00412         precision < 0)
00413     {
00414         // no special formatting (width or precision) required
00415 
00416         if(10 == base)
00417         {
00418             ff_char_t           sz[21];
00419             size_t              n;
00420             ff_char_t const*    s = stlsoft::integer_to_string(&sz[0], STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(sz), value, n);
00421 
00422             return ff_to_i_r_t_(s, n);
00423         }
00424         else
00425         {
00426             FASTFORMAT_CONTRACT_ENFORCE_ASSUMPTION(16 == base);
00427 
00428             return hex_integer_helper(value, uppercaseAlpha);
00429         }
00430     }
00431     else
00432     {
00433         // Performance tests with ff::real() showed a substantial advantage
00434         // in using integer_to_string() over fastformat_util_snprintf() for
00435         // the preparation of the format string, so we'll do so again here,
00436         // even though it's a little more complex, due to the need to work
00437         // for different integral types.
00438 
00439         // Now need to prepare the format string, and then invoke integer_helper_2()
00440         //
00441         // 1. %
00442         // 2. width
00443         // 3. .
00444         // 4. precision
00445         // 5. type
00446         // 6. nul
00447 
00448         ff_char_t           fmt_[101]; // max possible is 1 ('%') + 20 + 1 + 20 + 2 ('ld')
00449         ff_char_t*          fmt     =   fmt_;
00450         ff_char_t const*    type;
00451         size_t              typeLen;
00452 
00453         if(10 == base)
00454         {
00455 #ifdef FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00456             type    =   stlsoft::integral_printf_traits<I>::format_w() + 1;
00457 #else /* ? FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00458             type    =   stlsoft::integral_printf_traits<I>::format_a() + 1;
00459 #endif /* FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00460             typeLen =   stlsoft::c_str_len(type);
00461         }
00462         else
00463         {
00464             FASTFORMAT_CONTRACT_ENFORCE_ASSUMPTION(16 == base);
00465 
00466 #ifdef FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS
00467             type    =   stlsoft::integral_printf_traits<I>::hex_format_w() + 1;
00468 #else /* ? FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00469             type    =   stlsoft::integral_printf_traits<I>::hex_format_a() + 1;
00470 #endif /* FASTFORMAT_USE_WIDE_STRINGS */
00471             typeLen =   stlsoft::c_str_len(type);
00472         }
00473 
00474         if(default_width_sentinel_() == minimumWidth)
00475         {
00476             minimumWidth = 0;
00477         }
00478         if(precision < 0)
00479         {
00480             precision = (0 == value) ? 1 : 0;
00481         }
00482 
00483         const size_t    fmtDim  =   STLSOFT_NUM_ELEMENTS(fmt_) - 1;
00484         ff_char_t*      end     =   &fmt[fmtDim];
00485         size_t          n1;
00486         size_t          n2;
00487 
00488         // Because integer_to_string (i) writes backwards, and (ii) appends
00489         // a nul terminator, we need to do this is a strange order
00490 
00491         // 4. precision
00492         stlsoft::integer_to_string(end - (21 + typeLen), 21, precision, n1);
00493 
00494         // 5. type
00495         ::memcpy(end - (typeLen + 1), type, sizeof(ff_char_t) * typeLen);
00496         if(uppercaseAlpha)
00497         {
00498             // Make only the first (should be only) 'x' uppercase
00499             make_x_upper_(end - (typeLen + 1), end - (typeLen + 1) + typeLen);
00500         }
00501 
00502         // 6. nul
00503         *--end = '\0';
00504 
00505         end -= typeLen;
00506         end -= n1;
00507 
00508         // 2. width
00509         stlsoft::integer_to_string(end - 21, 21, minimumWidth, n2);
00510 
00511         // 3. .
00512         *--end = '.';
00513 
00514         end -= n2;
00515 
00516         // 1. %
00517         *--end = '%';
00518         fmt = end;
00519 
00520         return integer_helper_2(value, fmt);
00521     }
00522 }
00523 
00524 template <typename I>
00525 inline ff_to_i_r_t_ integer_helper_3(
00526     I const&    value
00527 ,   int         minimumWidth
00528 ,   int         precision
00529 )
00530 {
00531     return integer_helper_5(value, minimumWidth, precision, 10, false);
00532 }
00533 
00534 template <typename I>
00535 inline ff_to_i_r_t_ integer_helper_hex_3(
00536     I const&    value
00537 ,   int         minimumWidth
00538 ,   int         precision
00539 ,   int         uppercaseX
00540 )
00541 {
00542     return integer_helper_5(value, minimumWidth, precision, 16, uppercaseX);
00543 }
00544 
00545 } /* namespace ximpl_integer */
00546 #endif /* !FASTFORMAT_DOCUMENTATION_SKIP_SECTION */
00547 
00548 /* /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00549  * Inserter functions
00550  */
00551 
00568 template <typename I>
00569 inline ximpl_integer::ff_to_i_r_t_ integer(
00570     I const&    value
00571 ,   int         minimumWidth
00572 ,   int         precision
00573 )
00574 {
00575     STLSOFT_STATIC_ASSERT(stlsoft::is_integral_type<I>::value);
00576 
00577     FASTFORMAT_CONTRACT_ENFORCE_PRECONDITION_PARAMS_APPL_LAYER(abs(minimumWidth) < 512, "maximum value for width exceeded");
00578     FASTFORMAT_CONTRACT_ENFORCE_PRECONDITION_PARAMS_APPL_LAYER(abs(minimumWidth) < 1 || precision <= abs(minimumWidth), "decimal places must not exceed width");
00579 
00580     return ximpl_integer::integer_helper_3(value, minimumWidth, precision);
00581 }
